intro: Eupatorium madrense, commonly known as Madreños feverfew, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in folk remedies.
